Package org.cesecore.keys.token

Class PKCS11CryptoToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.keys.token.BaseCryptoToken
      • org.cesecore.keys.token.PKCS11CryptoToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CryptoToken, P11SlotUser
    public class PKCS11CryptoToken
extends BaseCryptoToken
implements P11SlotUser
    Class implementing a keystore on PKCS11 tokens.

      • DO_NOT_ADD_P11_PROVIDER

        public static final String DO_NOT_ADD_P11_PROVIDER
        Flag that if set, prevent adding the P11 provider with Security.addProvider. Can be used to create a crypto token without actually installing it in Java Security, so it can be created temporarily
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SLOT_LIST_INDEX_KEY

public static final String SLOT_LIST_INDEX_KEY

      • TOKEN_FRIENDLY_NAME

        public static final String TOKEN_FRIENDLY_NAME
        A user defined name of the slot provider. Used in order to be able to have two different providers (with different PKCS#11 attributes) for the same slot. If this is not set (null), the default java provider name is used (SunPKCS11-pkcs11LibName-slotNr for example SunPKCS11-libcryptoki.so-slot1).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(Properties properties,
                 byte[] data,
                 int id)
          throws CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                 NoSuchSlotException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Method called after creation of instance. Gives the object it's properties. Info contains Crypto Token properties, as entered for all tokens. Properties can create properties used by extending or wrapping classes so the implementing class should not delete or remove properties that are unknown to it, but keep them transparently. Data contains Crypto Token data, can be null for tokens that don't need it.
        Specified by:
        init in interface CryptoToken
        Parameters:
        properties - Properties info used to create token, new token or init existing token
        data - byte[] data as created internally for tokens, can be null for tokens that don't need it
        id - unique ID of the user of the token, the id is user defined and not used internally for anything but logging.
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException
        NoSuchSlotException

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Description copied from interface: P11SlotUser
        The user should return true if not accepting a slot reset.
        Specified by:
        isActive in interface P11SlotUser
        Returns:
        true if the slot is being used.

      • activate

        public void activate​(char[] authCode)
              throws CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                     CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Method used to activate Crypto Tokens when connected after being offline.
        Specified by:
        activate in interface CryptoToken
        Parameters:
        authCode - used to unlock crypto token, i.e PIN for smartcard HSMs. This parameter might be ignored, e.g. for auto-activated soft tokens.
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if Crypto Token is not available or connected.
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - with error message if authentication to tokens fail.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Resets token. Might cure HW failures. It is up to each implementation to implement this or not.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface CryptoToken

                        NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                        CertificateException,
                        IOException,
                        CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Deletes an entry in the crypto token
        Specified by:
        deleteEntry in interface CryptoToken
        Parameters:
        alias - is a reference to the entry in the token that should be deleted.
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - on fail
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm not found
        CertificateException - on invalid cert
        IOException - on IO error
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if offline

      • generateKeyPair

        public void generateKeyPair​(String keySpec,
                            String alias)
                     throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                            CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Generates a key pair (asymmetric keys) in the crypto token.
        Specified by:
        generateKeyPair in interface CryptoToken
        Parameters:
        keySpec - all decimal digits RSA key length, otherwise name of ECC curve or DSA key using syntax DSAnnnn
        alias - the name of the key pair in the crypto token
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if params are invalid
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if offline

      • generateKeyPair

        public void generateKeyPair​(AlgorithmParameterSpec spec,
                            String alias)
                     throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                            CertificateException,
                            IOException,
                            CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Generates a key pair (asymmetric keys) in the crypto token. This method is used when you have an existing PublicKey and want to generate a key of the same type. You can use KeyTools to get the AlgorithmParameterSpec from an existing PublicKey. 
         AlgorithmParameterSpec spec = KeyTools.getKeyGenSpec(templatePublicKey);
        Specified by:
        generateKeyPair in interface CryptoToken
        Parameters:
        spec - AlgorithmParameterSpec describing the key pair to be generated
        alias - the name of the key pair in the crypto token
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - On invalid parameters
        CertificateException - On invalid certificate
        IOException - On IO error
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if offline

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey​(String algorithm,
                        int keysize,
                        String alias)
                 throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                        NoSuchProviderException,
                        KeyStoreException,
                        CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Generates a symmetric key.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface CryptoToken
        Parameters:
        algorithm - symmetric algorithm specified in http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html, suggest AES, DESede or DES
        keysize - keysize of symmetric key, suggest 128 or 256 for AES, 64 for 168 for DESede and 64 for DES
        alias - the alias the key will get in the keystore
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - of algo not found
        NoSuchProviderException - If provider not found
        KeyStoreException - If store fails
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if offline

      • getTokenData

        public byte[] getTokenData()
        Description copied from interface: CryptoToken
        Stores keystore data (if any) to be used when initializing a new (existing) token with the init method
        Specified by:
        getTokenData in interface CryptoToken
        Returns:
        byte[] with keystore data, can be null if not needed for initialization

      • permitExtractablePrivateKeyForTest

        public boolean permitExtractablePrivateKeyForTest()
        Description copied from class: BaseCryptoToken
        Similar to the method above, but only applies for internal testing of keys. This method is called during testKeyPair to verify that a key that is extractable can never be used, unless we allow extractable private keys. Used for PKCS#11 (HSMs) to ensure that they are configured correctly. On a PKCS11 Crypto Token, this should return the same as doPermitExtractablePrivateKey(), on a Soft Crypto Token this should always return true.
        Specified by:
        permitExtractablePrivateKeyForTest in class BaseCryptoToken
        Returns:
        false if the key must not be extractable, this will throw an error if the key is extractable when crypto token tries to test it.
